Annotation.note:
The side $BC$ of the triangle $ABC$ touches the incircle $(I)$ in $X$ and the excircle $(J)$ relative to $BC$ in $Y$. If the parallels to $AY$ through $B$; $C$ meet the bisectors $CI$, $BI$ in $L$, $M$ show that the line $LM$ is parallel to $BC$.
\begin{keywords} geometry theorem proving \end{keywords}
